intro: Stenostephanus lugonis, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, velvety foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, clinging to trees in its natural habitat. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, and white, and bloom throughout the year under proper care. Stenostephanus lugonis is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
